thread.title: Liberals take Saint. Boniface - Saint. Vital with Dan Vandal
thread.title_full: Liberals take Saint. Boniface - Saint. Vital with Dan Vandal - Winnipeg Free Press

author: winnipegfreepress.com
title: Liberals take Saint. Boniface - Saint. Vital with Dan Vandal
text:
The red wave has swept into Winnipeg, sending Saint Boniface-Saint Vital back into the hands of the Liberal Party with the election of former St. Boniface city councillor Dan Vandal, according to early poll results.
Voters in the southeastern Winnipeg riding chose overwhelmingly that Vandal, who is also Métis, was their candidate choice, besting a former NDP MLA and taking back a riding that had been Conservative since 2008.
Conservative candidate François Catellier, along with former Southdale MLA NDP candidate Erin Selby, were his main competitors.
It was originally predicted to be a tight race between Vandal and Conservative MP Shelly Glover, who is Métis and was a senior cabinet minister under the Harper Conservatives. However, all bets were off after the Heritage Minister made a surprise announcement in April that she wouldn’t be seeking re-election and instead was going back to police work.
Her Conservative replacement, Catellier, who runs his own consulting company ran a low-key campaign wasn’t able to capitalize on the popularity of his predecessor enough to compete against Vandal, who was the councillor for St. Boniface for over a decade.
The riding had been held by the Liberals from the late 1980’s to 2008, until Glover unseated Raymond Simard, who had been the Liberal MP since 2002, in 2008.
In 2011, Simard made a second stab at the seat, but lost again after Glover got over 50 per cent of the vote.
Things became even more surprising in the race after Selby made a last-minute announcement she would run for the NDP.
